de.esoco.lib.comm

Class SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest<I,O>

            • de.esoco.lib.comm.SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest<I,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryFunction<I,Connection,O>, java.util.function.Function<I,O>, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmtpEndpoint.SmtpRequest, SocketEndpoint.BinaryRequest, SocketEndpoint.TextRequest
    Enclosing class:
    SocketEndpoint

    public abstract static class SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest<I,O>
extends CommunicationMethod<I,O>
    A generic base class for socket communication method that sends data to an endpoint socket and optionally receives a response. Subclasses must either override and implement the two methods writeRequest(Connection, OutputStream, Object) and readResponse(Connection, InputStream) or perform the complete request handling in sendRequest(Connection, OutputStream, InputStream, Object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • doOn

        public O doOn(Connection rConnection,
              I rRequest)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented by subclasses to perform the actual communication over a connection to execute this method. This method must always be invoked with explicit parameters. An implicit default input value will only be considered by the standard method AbstractBinaryFunction.evaluate(Object).
        Specified by:
        doOn in class CommunicationMethod<I,O>
        Parameters:

        rRequest - The input value for this communication method

        The output value according to this method's definition

      • readResponse

        protected O readResponse(Connection rConnection,
                         java.io.InputStream rInputStream)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented by subclasses to read q request response from the given input stream of the current socket if not overriding sendRequest(Connection, OutputStream, InputStream, Object). The default implementation always returns NULL.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection to read the response from
        rInputStream - The socket input stream to read from
        Returns:
        The processed response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown to indicate errors

      • sendRequest

        protected O sendRequest(Connection rConnection,
                        java.io.OutputStream rOutput,
                        java.io.InputStream rInput,
                        I rData)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sends the request through the socket and processes the response. The standard implementation invokes writeRequest(Connection, OutputStream, Object) and readResponse(Connection, InputStream). Subclasses may alternatively override this method, e.g. for more complex requests that need to perform some kind of handshake.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection for the current request
        rOutput - The output stream to send the request through
        rInput - The input stream to read the response from
        rData - The request data to send
        Returns:
        The processed response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown to indicate errors

      • writeRequest

        protected void writeRequest(Connection rConnection,
                            java.io.OutputStream rOutputStream,
                            I rRequest)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented by subclasses to write a request to the given output stream of the current socket if not overriding sendRequest(Connection, OutputStream, InputStream, Object). The implementation doesn't need to flush the output stream, this will be handled by the base implementation. But it may be necessary to flush stream wrappers like instances of Writer.

        The default implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection to write the request to
        rOutputStream - The socket output stream to write to
        rRequest - The request to write
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown to indicate errors
